result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank L Hoffer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $192 paid in full from bond.
Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment for 40 hrs a week. Any week not reaching 40 hours will do 20 hours of community service.

Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with AH without agent approval. Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Not use/possess alcohol (Maintain absolute sobriety).

Alcohol sobrietor device for at least first 12 mo. Agent can extend longer. Completion of DOC domestic violence treatment. DNA on file. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

11:13 AM Defendant Frank L Hoffer in court with Attorney Mark A. Leonard.  ADA Carl Jacob Lazarus in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 4.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DRI Count #1, 2 and 3.

Statement by victim, Alaia H.

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #4   
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, cc to 20CF1325 and 21CF1877

CONDITIONS:
-Maintain full-time employment/education or a combination of both or be seeking same and treatment for 40 hours a week. Any week not reaching 40 hours will do 20 hours of community service. 
-No contact with: Alaia H., without agent approval
-Not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription
-Not use/possess alcohol (Absolute Sobriety)
-Alcohol sobrietor device for at least first 12 months. Agent can extend longer.
-DOC DV treatment
-DNA on file
-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #4
-DA surcharge
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. DA surcharge and V/W surcharge due on probation.

-Bond posted to be applied to fines and cc only and remainder returned to poster.

-Days credit for time already served: 1 day credit
-Days credit if revoked: 1 day credit

Defendant here today at Collections window to apply for county appointed attorney - to return with completed Petition for Counsel, bring along SPD Financial Eligibility Worksheet and provide most recent paystub.
Status conference on August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Cash bond is set in the amount of $500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Alaia H. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 100-500 blocks of Shane Ct in Sun Prairie. 
- Defendant shall not be at any bar, tavern, liquor store, or other premises whose primary purpose is the sale or service of alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

03:27 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kara M Rolf.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
